snippet: Defense officials said that more American troops would be stationed in Germany and Italy as the United States sought to counter a more aggressive Russia.
abstract: Defense Department plans to close at least 15 military bases in Europe, consolidating forces in move that will save about $500 million annually; actual number of troops will not be reduced, but reassignment is designed to counter more aggressive Russia.
lead_paragraph: Defense officials said that more American troops would be stationed in Germany and Italy as the United States sought to counter a more aggressive Russia.

headline.main: U.S. Consolidates Forces in Europe to Save Money
headline.print_headline: U.S. Consolidates Forces in Europe to Save Money

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
